title: Mean Streets
description: A small-time hood aspires to work his way up the ranks of the mob in Little Italy, but struggles with his Catholic upbringing and loyalty to his reckless friend.

title: Modern Times
description: The Tramp struggles to live in modern industrial society with the help of a young homeless woman.

title: The Gold Rush
description: In this classic silent comedy, Charlie Chaplin's iconic tramp character braves the harsh conditions of the Klondike Gold Rush, encountering humor, romance, and adventure amidst the snow-covered landscapes.

title: The Thin Blue Line
description: In 'The Thin Blue Line,' filmmaker Errol Morris investigates the case of a man wrongfully convicted of murder, revealing the flaws in the justice system and the power of documentary filmmaking to challenge prevailing narratives.

title: Life Itself
description: 'Life Itself' is a documentary film directed by Steve James, chronicling the life and career of film critic Roger Ebert. Through interviews, archival footage, and Ebert's own writings, the film explores his impact on film criticism and his personal journey, including his battle with cancer.

title: Gates of Heaven
description: 'Gates of Heaven' is a documentary directed by Errol Morris. The film explores the pet cemetery business, focusing on two such cemeteries in California and the people who run them. Through interviews with the cemetery owners and pet owners, the film delves into themes of love, loss, and the human-animal bond.

title: The Look of Silence
description: In 'The Look of Silence,' director Joshua Oppenheimer follows an optometrist named Adi as he confronts the individuals responsible for the Indonesian genocide of the 1960s, including those who murdered his own brother. Through Adi's journey, the film examines memory, trauma, and the legacy of violence.

title: Tabloid
description: 'Tabloid' is a documentary directed by Errol Morris, focusing on the strange case of Joyce McKinney, a former beauty queen who was accused of kidnapping and raping a Mormon missionary in the 1970s. Through interviews with McKinney and others involved, the film explores themes of obsession, love, and the media.

title: Rain Man
description: In 'Rain Man,' Charlie Babbitt discovers that his estranged brother Raymond, an autistic savant, has inherited their deceased father's fortune. As Charlie attempts to gain custody of Raymond to access the money, the two embark on a journey that profoundly impacts both their lives.

title: Valkyrie
description: In 'Valkyrie,' Colonel Claus von Stauffenberg, played by Tom Cruise, leads a daring plot to assassinate Adolf Hitler and overthrow the Nazi regime during World War II. With a team of fellow German officers, Stauffenberg hatches a plan known as Operation Valkyrie, aiming to bring an end to tyranny and restore honor to their country.

title: Lions for Lambs
description: Lions for Lambs interweaves several storylines, including a senator's bold new political move, a journalist chasing a breaking story, and two soldiers trapped behind enemy lines. As the characters' lives intersect, they must confront difficult ethical questions amidst the backdrop of the Afghanistan war.

title: Annie Hall
description: Neurotic New York comedian Alvy Singer falls in love with the ditzy Annie Hall.

title: Vicky Cristina Barcelona
description: Two girlfriends on a summer holiday in Spain become enamored with the same painter, unaware that his ex-wife, with whom he has a tempestuous relationship, is about to re-enter the picture.

title: Radio Days
description: A nostalgic look at radio's golden age focusing on one ordinary family and the various performers in the medium.

title: Manhattan
description: The life of a divorced television writer dating a teenage girl is further complicated when he falls in love with his best friend's mistress.

title: The Purple Rose of Cairo
description: In 1930s New Jersey, a movie character walks off the screen and into the real world.

title: Everyone Says I Love You
description: A New York girl sets her father up with a beautiful woman in a troubled marriage while her stepsister gets engaged.

title: Mighty Aphrodite
description: When he discovers his adopted son is a genius, a New York sportswriter seeks out the boy's birth mother: a ditzy porn star and prostitute.

title: Everything You Always Wanted to Know About Sex *But Were Afraid to Ask
description: A collection of seven vignettes based on the book by the same name, exploring aspects of human sexuality.

title: Broadway Danny Rose
description: A hapless talent manager's latest client is a washed-up lounge singer who might have a chance at a big comeback.

title: Celebrity
description: The fortunes of a husband and wife differ drastically after they divorce.

title: Sweet and Lowdown
description: Emmet Ray (Sean Penn) isn't an easy guy to be around -- among other things, he's inconsiderate and egomaniacal. He also happens to be a jazz guitarist with undeniable talent, and despite his many faults, he ends up winning the heart of Hattie (Samantha Morton), a kind young mute woman. Hattie's seemingly endless patience with Emmet is tested, however, with his incessant irresponsibility and infidelity, leading their relationship to the breaking point.

title: Another Woman
description: A philosophy professor finds herself embroiled in affairs of the heart and mind as she reflects on her life and relationships.

title: Deconstructing Harry
description: A novelist deals with his personal issues and the people around him through the characters he creates in his writing.

title: The General
description: During the Civil War, a Southern engineer is faced with the dilemma of whether to sabotage a Confederate train.

title: Sherlock Jr.
description: A film projectionist longs to be a detective, and his dreams blur with reality when he is framed for theft and falls in love.

title: Blue Velvet
description: A young man's curiosity leads him into a dark underworld of sex, violence, and mystery in a small American town.

title: Stagecoach
description: John Ford's landmark Western revolves around an assorted group of colorful passengers aboard the Overland stagecoach bound for Lordsburg, New Mexico, in the 1880s. An alcoholic philosophizer (Thomas Mitchell), a lady of ill repute (Claire Trevor) and a timid liquor salesman (Donald Meek) are among the motley crew of travelers who must contend with an escaped outlaw, the Ringo Kid (John Wayne), and the ever-present threat of an Apache attack as they make their way across the Wild West.

title: Red River
description: Headstrong Thomas Dunson (John Wayne) starts a thriving Texas cattle ranch with the help of his faithful trail hand, Groot (Walter Brennan), and his protégé, Matt Garth (Montgomery Clift), an orphan Dunson took under his wing when Matt was a boy. In need of money following the Civil War, Dunson and Matt lead a cattle drive to Missouri, where they will get a better price than locally, but the crotchety older man and his willful young partner begin to butt heads on the exhausting journey.

title: McLintock!
description: A wealthy cattle rancher fights against various troubles at home and at work.

title: Bullets Over Broadway
description: Struggling 1920s playwright David Shayne (John Cusack), having failed to secure financing for his latest work, reluctantly makes a deal with mob boss Nick Valenti (Joe Viterelli) : a Broadway debut with the chance to direct, as long as Nick's flibbertigibbet girlfriend, Olive (Jennifer Tilly), plays one of the lead roles. As Olive and star Helen Sinclair (Dianne Wiest) attempt to upstage each other, Olive's gangland bodyguard Cheech (Chazz Palminteri) starts suggesting changes to David's script.

title: Angel and the Badman
description: A wounded outlaw is sheltered by a Quaker family, causing him to reevaluate his life and beliefs.

title: Legend of the Lost
description: A man and a woman searching for a lost treasure find themselves in an adventure across the Sahara Desert.

title: The Philadelphia Story
description: This classic romantic comedy focuses on Tracy Lord (Katharine Hepburn), a Philadelphia socialite who has split from her husband, C.K. Dexter Haven (Cary Grant), due both to his drinking and to her overly demanding nature. As Tracy prepares to wed the wealthy George Kittredge (John Howard), she crosses paths with both Dexter and prying reporter Macaulay Connor (James Stewart). Unclear about her feelings for all three men, Tracy must decide whom she truly loves.

title: Hannibal
description: Hannibal Lecter resurfaces in Italy and becomes the target of a disfigured and vengeful victim from his past, while a FBI agent seeks to capture him for his past crimes.

title: Absolution
description: When a contract killer (Steven Seagal) encounters a girl on the run from a mob boss (Vinnie Jones) with powerful political ties, he is torn between protecting the girl and remaining loyal to the government agency that hired him for the mission.

title: The Asian Connection
description: Two American expatriates, Jack and Sam, unwittingly steal a drug lord's money when they rob a series of banks in Southeast Asia and become the target of the gang's vengeance.

title: Sniper: Special Ops
description: A Special Ops military Force, led by Sergeant Vic Mosby (Tim Abell) with an expert sniper Sergeant Jake Chandler (Steven Seagal) as Over Watch during a special mission are sent to a remote Afghan village to extract an American Congressman being held by the Taliban.

title: Ticker
description: Ray Nettles, a San Francisco detective, and his partner Fuzzy must take on to one of the most dangerous terrorist gangs in the city. When one of the terrorists, the beautiful scientist Claire Manning is arrested, Swann, the leader of the terrorists, claims he will detonate bombs throughout the city if she is not released. Because of the possible bloodshed, Nettles calls for the help of explosives expert Frank Glass.

title: After Hours
description: An ordinary word processor has the worst night of his life after he agrees to visit a girl in Soho whom he met that evening at a coffee shop.

title: A Good Man
description: Alexander's special operations career ends in disaster, and he goes off the grid to live a quiet life as a handyman. When one of his tenants is targeted by a Russian mobster, Alexander is dragged into a war between the Chinese and Russian gangs.

title: Force of Execution
description: A crime lord's right-hand man, who falls for a woman targeted by the mob boss, seeks to turn his back on a life of crime.

title: A Woman, a Gun, and a Noodle Shop
description: At boss Wang's traditional Chinese noodle shop, a colourful and exotic Persian trader of arms introduces the shop owner's wife to the weapons of the West, and consequently, to mankind's greatest invention: the handgun. As a result, the woman excited with her newest acquisition that kills instantly, a brass, triple-muzzle top-break revolver, naturally, she will need more, however, the loud noise of the firearms' demonstration will inevitably attract a brigade of the local police force who will drop by for an investigation. Soon, grouchy old miser Wang will find out everything about his double-crossing wife's affair with the Inn's mincing weakling apprentice Li, and as the corpses begin piling up, it's going to be every man for himself and all for Wang's crammed strongbox

title: Paths of Glory
description: During World War I, commanding officer General Broulard (Adolphe Menjou) orders his subordinate, General Mireau (George Macready), to attack a German trench position, offering a promotion as an incentive. Though the mission is foolhardy to the point of suicide, Mireau commands his own subordinate, Colonel Dax (Kirk Douglas), to plan the attack. When it ends in disaster, General Mireau demands the court-martial of three random soldiers in order to save face.

title: Reservoir Dogs
description: Six criminals with pseudonyms, and each strangers to one another, are hired to carry out a robbery. The heist is ambushed by police and the gang are forced to shoot their way out. At their warehouse rendezvous, the survivors, realising that they were set up, try to find the traitor in their midst.

title: Lolita
description: With a screenplay penned by the author himself, Stanley Kubrick brings Vladimir Nabokov's controversial tale of forbidden love to the screen. Humbert Humbert (James Mason) is a European professor who relocates to an American suburb, renting a room from lonely widow Charlotte Haze (Shelley Winters). Humbert marries Charlotte, but only to nurture his obsession with her comely teenage daughter, Lolita (Sue Lyon). After Charlotte's sudden death, Humbert has Lolita all to himself -- or does he?

title: Fear and Desire
description: An anti-war film directed by Stanley Kubrick, following a small squad of soldiers who crash behind enemy lines and must confront their own fears and desires.

title: Barry Lyndon
description: A historical drama film directed by Stanley Kubrick, based on the 1844 novel 'The Luck of Barry Lyndon' by William Makepeace Thackeray.

title: Fahrenheit 9/11
description: Fahrenheit 9/11 is a documentary film written and directed by Michael Moore. The film examines the presidency of George W. Bush, the War on Terror, and the aftermath of the September 11 attacks. Through interviews, news footage, and analysis, Moore presents a critical perspective on the administration's actions, policies, and their impact on American society. Fahrenheit 9/11 sparked widespread debate and controversy upon its release, becoming one of the highest-grossing documentaries of all time.

title: Flawless
description: Flawless is a crime drama film directed by Joel Schumacher. Set in New York City, the film follows the unlikely friendship between a retired security guard suffering from a stroke, Walter Koontz, played by Robert De Niro, and a drag queen named Rusty, portrayed by Philip Seymour Hoffman. When Walter becomes the victim of a robbery and loses his ability to speak, Rusty helps him to recover through singing lessons. As their bond deepens, they embark on a journey of self-discovery and redemption, challenging societal norms and prejudices. With powerful performances and poignant storytelling, Flawless explores themes of acceptance, forgiveness, and the human capacity for change.
